qas.question: What is the definition of a charity?

answers.text: nonprofit organisation that meets stricter criteria regarding its purpose and the method in which it makes decisions and reports its finances

qas.question: Where are charity organizations registered in England and Wales?
Where would an NPO or charity organization register in Scotland?

answers.text: Office of the Scottish Charity Regulator

qas.question: What is one of the contraints of an NPO with regards to assets?

answers.text: generally not allowed to pay its Trustees

qas.question: Is a trade union governed by the Office of the Scottish Charity Regulator?

answers.text: not regarded as "charities" in the technical sense

plausible_answers.text: a nonprofit organisation that meets stricter criteria regarding its purpose and the method in which it makes decisions and reports its finances

qas.question: What is the definition of a trade union?
Where are trade unions registered in England and Wales?

plausible_answers.text: the Office of the Scottish Charity Regulator

qas.question: Where are trade unions registered in Scotland?
Who is the Charity Commission not allowed to pay?
What are trustees subject to that other groups aren't?

context: A charity is <b5_0>a <a0_0>nonprofit organisation that meets stricter criteria regarding its purpose and the method in which it makes decisions and reports its finances<b5_0/><a0_0/>. For example, a charity is <a3_0>generally not allowed to pay its <b8_0>Trustees<b8_0/><a3_0/>. In England and Wales, charities may be registered with <b6_0>the <a1_0>Charity Commission<b6_0/><a1_0/>. In Scotland, <b7_0>the <a2_0>Office of the Scottish Charity Regulator<b7_0/><a2_0/> serves the same function. Other organizations which are classified as nonprofit organizations elsewhere, such as trade unions, are subject to <b9_0>separate regulations<b9_0/>, and are <a4_0>not regarded as "charities" in the technical sense<a4_0/>.
